qas.question: What type of religion is Buddhism?
What are the practices of Buddhism based on?
How do Buddhists believe their suffering can be ended?

answers.text: through the direct understanding and perception of dependent origination and the Four Noble Truths

qas.question: What did the Buddha teach should be given up to end suffering?
What type of religion is Buddhism?
Who's teaching is Buddhism based upon?
Where did Buddha reside when he was alive?
Who's teachings is Buddhism based upon?
Where was Buddha thought to live?

answers.text: sometime between the 6th and 4th centuries BCE

qas.question: Buddhism is based on the teaching of who?
How many noble truths are there?
Buddha was part of what subcontinent?

context: Buddhism /ˈbudɪzəm/ is a <a0_0><a5_0>nontheistic<a0_0/> religion<a5_0/>[note 1] or philosophy (Sanskrit: धर्म dharma; Pali: धम्म dhamma) that encompasses a variety of traditions, beliefs and spiritual practices largely based on <a1_0>teachings attributed to <a6_0><a9_0><a12_0>Gautama <a15_0>Buddha<a15_0/><a12_0/><a9_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/>, commonly known as the Buddha ("the awakened one"). According to Buddhist tradition, the Buddha lived and taught in the eastern part of the <a14_0>Indian<a14_0/> subcontinent, <a2_0><a8_0>present-day <a10_0>Nepal<a10_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/> <a11_0>sometime <a7_0>between the 6th and <a13_0>4<a13_0/>th centuries BCE<a11_0/><a7_0/>.[note 1] He is recognized by Buddhists as an awakened or enlightened teacher who shared his insights to help sentient beings end their suffering through the elimination of <a4_0>ignorance and craving<a4_0/>. Buddhists believe that this is accomplished <a3_0>through the direct understanding and perception of dependent origination and the Four Noble Truths<a3_0/>.
